results.name: In base 2: start with n; if palindrome, stop; otherwise add to itself with digits reversed; a(n) gives palindrome at which it stops, or -1 if no palindrome is ever reached.
comment: The analog of A033865 in base 2.
link: Index entries for sequences related to Reverse and Add!
Klaus Brockhaus, On the'Reverse and Add!' algorithm in base 2
mathematica: limit = 10^4; (* Assumes that there is no palindrome if none is found before "limit" iterations *)
program: (ARIBAS): stop := 500; for k := 0 to 60 do c := 0; m := k; rev := bit_reverse(m); while m <> rev and c < stop do inc(c); m := m + rev; rev := bit_reverse(m); end; if c < stop then bit_write(m); else write(-1); end; write(" "); end;.
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jun 06 2001
